abstract.text: The general interface for managing allocation of data buffers to be used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Classes adopting this protocol provide different ways of handling mesh buffer data. For example, the
class can share mesh data with Metal buffers for use in rendering.
When you load meshes from a file with the
class or generate meshes with the

class, you must specify an allocator. By choosing an allocator specific to how you use a mesh, you can ensure that vertex and index data for the mesh is copied and transformed a minimal number of times between loading and use.

abstract.text: An interface for allocating a MetalKit buffer that backs the vertex data of a Model I/O mesh, suitable for use in a Metal app.
Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.
An indexed container for 3D objects and associated information, such as transform hierarchies, meshes, cameras, and lights.
A container for vertex buffer data to be used in rendering a 3D object.
The general interface for managing storage of vertex and index data used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.
The general interface for managing allocation of data buffers to be used in loading, processing, and rendering meshes.
Creates a new buffer of the specified length.
Creates a new buffer containing the specified data in the specified zone.
Creates a new buffer of the specified length in the specified zone.
Creates a new buffer containing the specified data.
Creates a zone for related memory allocations.
Creates a zone large enough to fit the specified group of allocation sizes.
A memory buffer that stores vertex or index data for a Model I/O mesh.
A basic allocator implementation that allocates from main memory using data objects.
An object that manages access to a memory buffer used for the data storage of a Model I/O mesh.
The general interface for logical pools of memory used in allocation of related mesh data buffers.
A standard implementation of the
protocol.
A description of the format of per-vertex data for a single vertex attribute in a mesh object.
An object that provides convenience access to vertex data for a specific vertex attribute of a mesh.
A
object describes layout information for a vertex buffer in a
object. A collection of vertex layer objects, vertex attribute objects, and additional information forms a
object, which completely describes the layout of vertex buffers for a mesh.
A description of the structure, format, and layout for vertex data buffers associated with a mesh.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
